resources.string: Oooh, it's been a long time since Vlad did a good old-fashioned revenge taking. That piece of shit Buluc is going to wish he was born in Switzerland!$NL;
That card should get you entry to one of the train railcars.
One of these is the truck carrying the voting machines to Washington. When you think you know which one it is, get the tracker on it and we can move on.
Find some, and pour it in.
That's the alarm. MPD response channels just went crazy. OK, no matter. Keep hacking those machines.
Find the goods. I'm sure you'll know it when you see it!
OK you're in, good. Now you need at least four paintings, the good ones have red stickers - those are the ones our art lover intends to buy.

We're using a magnetic crane to drop a little present in the path of the Gensec convoy - a steel container of professional badasses. Hit the trucks, and get the loot to the getaway. These docks have a rich history of heistery, gentlemen - do it proud.
There's a card reader by the security bars. Open it up.
...I'm sure. I'm pretty sure.
Alright. I need you to do one more errand before you bug out. Get to the security room and grab the footage from the cameras. Just in case they got anything incriminating.
From what we know, Buluc keeps to himself a lot, when not holding court, so you'll probably find him in his office. See if you can find it.
Thanks! My wrists hurt like hell!
Pilot dropped the supplies. Get them into the house.
Hey! I'm not leaving without MY car!
Put in the flash drive and get started.
Look at all these nice things. Must have done a lot of public service in his career.
You know the Romanovs, eh?
Open those Murkywater containers. If anything has illegal loot, it will be them.
Okay, our friend will know the way out, right? You just have to watch out for the guards.
Get everyone into the train.
Don't forget about those safe deposit boxes folks, can be good stuff in there.
You can expect the security to be very tight, cameras and everything.
That's how the pros do it! Chalk it up. Payday Gang one, Armadillo corp zero.
Great. Now find something else to steal. We need to make it look like a simple robbery.
That's the stuff. Keep going!
That should get it on.
Ah, There are my precious things! Hurry, Hurry, take them!
You see that fence? Cut it open and get inside.
They're sending reinforcements.
Keep sharp, gentleman. The warehouse will be tougher, but the rewards worth it.
Use your guns! Put him in the ocean to drown!
This is the warehouse. You can bet the better loot is right here.
Great, we got our quarry. Make sure the chop stays secure.
Shush! What's that sound... Hmm, seems, nah seems OK.
Another guard up ahead. Stay in the shadows.
Damn, there's the alarm. They're on to us. Get the saw ready.
Nicely done, friends! A job well done. We probably even emptied the Mayor's personal bank account this time!
I'll count down the time.
Find a way to sneak into his apartment, steal the gold and plant incriminating evidence against him. Then leave undetected.
...I... think.
Great, two keycards. That's what we need. Get to work and open that vault.
Good, OK, you can open the vault now. I have turned on the vault's camera feed as well.
There's only one place I can sell that. Marrakech.
It seems the armory has a different access level. You'll need to recode the key tag again.
They probably keep the evidence files in the chief's computer. Try the upper floor.
This is gonna be easy as long as you steer clear of the security systems and guards. Well maybe not so easy. Take the paintings with red sold stickers and clear out. We need four at least.
Easy enough. I got the next one too.
Look out the window - Taxman is the guy in the white shirt.
Caustic soda.
A little cash goes a long way. The local Harvest & Trustee branch bank needs to be lightened of its load. Let's do this bank hit, get their vault open, and fill our pockets a little.
There it is. Do your thing, guys, but Gage prefers you do it quietly. Front gate is dead ahead, but maybe you can find alternative routes.
Two card reader with a 10 second time lock? You can bet they're holding some serious hardware in that vault.
Well, that's quite a mess all right. Now get these bodies out of sight.
Quick! Answer his pager and make some crap up.
That's how the pro's do it! Awesome work gentlemen!
Dallas! There's a security guard outside and he's gonna see the broken camera. Take him out before he calls it in!
Strike that...
Pier 39. Tag the truck carrying the voting machines to Washington, and get back here. Let me stress, we're only here for the truck.
Ok, keep our little V.I.P. dwankie safe and out of trouble.
No-no-no-no-no!
Get the cooking going - we can't stay here - at all in fact!
Hey, Hey, HEY. Don't you wave this off. Bain and Vlad have a long history together. I care about this shit.
Mercy Hospital, please hold... Ok, now how can I help?
Those are all the bags we need but you guys know the drill, if you want more - stay and get more!
There you go. Now let's frame this guy, get up to the roof, and our guy will throw you the coke.
Alright, get to the house and find the address, be careful.
There you go! Hurry over to the vault.
Alright then. Hmm... it says there's also physical evidence.
You can't go wrong with gold. The Harvest & Trustee bank is trying to up its liquidity with a large deposit. It's something we should take advantage of, don't you think?
...that's my very best guess.
Looks like you need to find a specific office, then.
They bought it. Keep working.
That'll do for Gage, but you can stay for more.
Alright, that's the jewelery store. Get me the required amount and be ready for anything!
One moment please.
So, that's it, yeah? Alright, friends. You need to cut the correct wires in the cable boxes to break the lock.
Time to go!
They are climbing into the building!
Damn it, they're burning it!
Five.
This is a nice house. Would look better with some of Vlad's furniture.
The railway bridge! They are coming in from the railway bridge, keep them away.
Nope, that's not it!
Try and get by him unnoticed. Take your time.
Get to the computer so we can code the tag for access.
You're in the lair of the beast now, gang. Better loot, but bigger risk.
It should be muriatic acid!
That's the stuff. Get it to the van.
In unstable times like these, gold's all you can really depend on. So who wants to go stabilize our economic future? The Harvest & Trustee bank vault awaits.

Kerels are going to go bossies when they see what we are after, and will be coming after us in droves, so keep your eyes peeled and take them down fast. The longer you can keep them at bay, the more desperate they'll get and give us a bigger load of cash, yeah?
Nice haul! This will bring in a nice chunk of change. Good job!
Where the fuck is Ra√∫l? You were supposed to find him! I have 50 guests coming tonight and you pull this shit you fucking whore! I will send you back to fucking San Dimas!
Great, I'm in. Keep watching those hostages.
Never get tired of seeing gold bullion getting bagged.
You got snipers around there!
There's a lot of stuff in here! I guess you'll know what you're looking for when you see it.
There is old saying in Ukraine. Revenge is a dish best eaten by sharks.
Go to the armory and find something that opens doors!
It's muriatic acid.
This is Hilary over at Gensec. Just checking in. Is Barney there?
OK, friends. Let's do this. Make your way into the bank.
That's the warehouse where the voting machines are kept. Time for a little political engineering.
What's taking so long? Don't waste that thermite.
Going to be a long day, isn't it.
Gage has what he wants. Great work. You can bug out now, or hang around a little.
Feels like we're going to get a kakspul of payback with this one, friends.
...muriatic acid?
OK, here's the setup: we're looking for the paintings with red stickers on them. Security is going to be on the heavy side, cameras and guards.
Quietly now. Sneak up and hit them hard.
So the plan is, go in, get me the following objects. When you have them we'll connect them to our station on the roof.
Use that paper shredder - it's the easy way.
Great work. There's always a market for untraceable guns.
I require your assistance in a matter...
Remember: blood poisoning and abnormal heart rate. Listen to Schneider.
Good job, now let's get you into some scrubs.
Shit!
You can try finding vault keycards, two of them, if you want to sneak this place. Maybe in the trunks. Or go loud - it's your choice.
That's the ordnance, but it's not the turret. Get it out if you can, but keep looking.
It's nearby. Can I see the funds?
Illegal untraceable weapons. This is what Gage is all about.
There we go - green lights. Let the time lock do it's thing. I'd love to see the managers face when those doors swing wide open.
OK, keep that smoke to a minimum... Keep going.
Vault with simultaneous two card reader. Probably 10 second time lock. They must be hiding something tasty.
Alright... OK, we need at least four paintings, remember, the ones with red stickers.
Damnit, that's the alarm. Stay frosty and get ready!
Used dinars. Hard to trace. Perfect.
There we go. Hmm... it says there's physical evidence on our friend around here as well...
Ah, that's it friends. A nice little Payday, though I think we could have gotten more!
Yes?
Okay, what comes after that...
The other party is now a minute away.
Why the hell did some Iraqi dictactor have seventeenth century Swedish masterpieces?
OK, the vault's got the gold.
Ach, you're making me go bossies! We couldn't afford to lose anyone! Abort and return to the safehouse.
Armor of a Shogun. Nabunaga. Thought lost for centuries, but... here it is. Get the pieces bagged.
You still got your old reflexes, old friend. Quickly, get these bodies out of sight.
You know what to do. Signal the chopper, and we'll drop off more ingredients. Or bail. Your choice.
It takes special skills to ninja through a secure warehouse in broad daylight. Great work. Now, let's see if it was worth it.
If you don'get moving soon, I think Vlad's going to go bossies!
Find a means to destroy the evidence!
One more sample in the cooler before you can leave.
...muriatic acid?
That's the alarm guys. Watch out for the cops!
You are looking for muriatic acid, caustic soda and hydrogen chloride.
Sorry, that wasn't right.
He's at the trunk. He um....
These are the trucks. When you're done searching for clues, get the that GPS on the truck you think is carrying the voting machines to Washington.
Are you giving him the earpiece? Good!
...this isn't my specialty, really.
Good job, Dallas. You still have it in you. Now, throw the loot in the van and let's leave.
Look out for snipers!
Remember what I said: don't kill the guard. Your nonsense won't trick the Control-Guy again and he'll sound the alarm.
That's one of the external hard drives.
Looks like we got everything, gang, Your pick-up is on its way.
God dammit! Another guy, and this one's watching the server room. I guess you have to take him out as well.
You cleaned the joint out. Now we'll have perfect coverage in the senator's apartment. I'll ensure we get the surveillance equipment in the paintings and set up the trade.
Uhuh... uhuh... OK, sure. We'll have a look.
Now get to the ICU. Find and listen to Dr. Schneider, the patient we're looking for should have blood poisoning and an abnormal heart rate.
That's all we need but feel free to stick around for more.
Don't let the coppers take back the hostage.
Now go sack that armory, friends!
OK, that's the clubhouse. Bikers' got the address we need. Sneak in.
See if you can find Buluc's office. He apparently spends a lot of time in there, so it's a solid bet.
Those cameras won't be a problem anymore!
We need chemicals to cook. Muriatic acid, caustic soda and hydrogen chloride. Easy.
Yeah, the uh... monitor here just broke. Made a lot of noise. Scared an old lady but the janitor took care of her.
Alright I'm in! *whistles, impressed* These guys aren't messing around. Lots of additional firewalls.
We're doin' this shit for a fucking book?
Guys!... Guys! You still there?! Get... -out!
It feels bad to leave the gold, but we will get paid. Maybe we can return.
Get past the gates, but don't get spotted.
Uh... mhm...
Damn it! That's the alarm!
The concentration in that sample wasn't even close. You need to go again.
Nice... Seems to be OK.
Ach, that's what you get from dossing about, friends! They just took the hostage and we gotta go back empty-handed!
An inventor named Rossy - residing somewhere in DC - may have found a cheap way to produce energy from water.
You're through to Mortimer at Roberts Bank. I'd be happy to assist.
Keep the elevator under watch, guys.
Halfway there with the painting collection. Now just get the rest and we're home free.
Hi! Yes, what can I do for you?
OK - looks stable, for now. Add more stuff...
Nice and easy. Time for a casual stroll into the bank, yeah?
Public office. Wow, we are in the wrong line of work gentlemen.
Good, with that guy out of the picture, no more cameras.
You gotta get the security bars open. Crack open the card reader near it.
...these internet descriptions are iffy at best.
Guys, get into those cars and find the one with the turret.
There it is, right ahead. Do your thing, guys, but do it quietly. It goes loud, and I'll have to pull you out fast.
Damn! Someone must have found the body! Take him out before he sounds the alarm!
Go for it.
Good job. Answer the pager and then hide the body in the dumpster.
Just got a message from The Elephant. Your bonus for keeping things clandestine has been dropped off. It's near the escape van.
One of you guys answer the phone and patch me through.
Why isn't that chopper on any flight plans?
Hook me into the reception computer so that I can see where the doctors are keeping our target.
Your instincts are correct my friend. You'll have to take him out.
Great, you found the laptop.
I know that crest! it belonged to the Romanov dynasty, for sure!
Right. He got called in to a meeting with a big account. He's doing a great job.
Damn it! They've spotted you!
Great. There's no shortage of buyers for these military rounds.
Time to use the keycard you picked up. Have your gun ready and take out anyone on the other side of that door.
Now keep moving. And as much as you hate this, this is still a real thing. You get discovered you'll trigger the alarm.
I don't know how the bikers know we're coming but they do. Maybe all that meth they're doing gives them a sixth sense...
I have been in the bank one time, a few years ago. The bank manager is an idiot. He keeps his access key in a personal safe, but I don't actually remember where.
...I'm 72% sure.
Be careful! They have snipers incoming!
I can't wait to see what these shady assholes were hiding on that server.
OK guys, get inside and locate the art. We want the paintings with the red stickers on. Look out for guards and cameras.
Okay, what's next...
Your first job is getting into the depot. Scout the area, check for cameras and guards. Keep it quiet.
Alright, get ready! Get me the required amount of bags and I'll meet you at the safe house.
We need hydrogen chloride!
We need his phone, his tablet, his laptop and two external hard drives.
They tied him down. We'll need to cut him loose.
The domkops are trying to get off cheapsies with that offer, yeah? We can get more if we just don't give up.
You let them take the hostage, you chops! It's over, we gotta get you out of there.
It's on fire! The whole damn roof!
Today's our lucky day - cash delivery from the airport to this bank, all sorts of denominations... So I propose we do a little money exchange of our own.
Don't let them destroy any intel. Get it all!
You done? Good. Put on your mask now.
Look for something to crack those crates open.
Take a look around and see if you can find a clue on how to crack that code. Check the workstations.
Why do you keep going bossies over Bain? Look, we've got it under control, yeah?$NL;
Anything could be on that server. Maybe the President's email address.
A bit hairy in the end but you got there. I don't think we could have gotten another penny from those chops. Nice work!
My bad. It's muriatic acid.

Gensec are a big security company on the East Coast. Got a great reputation with the banks and politicians, but today we're going to see what we can do about that. Got a tip-off about a convoy coming into the city. We're going after it.
OK, OK, we gotta change this up!
You're almost there, everyone get your guns ready.
They are coming in from the forest next to the road! Keep them away!
The cell block is nearby. That's where they'll be keeping our friend.
OK, make your way inside. Keep it quiet.
Good job. Leave them there for now while we take care of the bank.
They're pretty antsy - just get the paintings on the table and keep both eyes open for anything weird.
See if you can find Buluc's secret meeting room. The solution for getting into his office should be there.
Great! That's one of our voting machines! Hack it when there's no one nearby. If they see what you're up to, things will get loud.
Look around. Search the Murkywater containers. Just grab any valuables you can.
This will be a tough one but you can handle it.
Uhm... didn't we solve this already?
...I'm 79% sure.
You know what to do with that!
That's it, fine work. The escape is ready for you. Unless you want to stick around and clean out the vault. Either way the vehicle's waiting.
Cameras will set of the mines, guys! Stay away!
That codex! Those symbols... that's how we get the Mayan door to open, yeah? Look around for more clues!
You going to keep this up all day?

Got a line on a recent drop of hard currency. It's tucked away in the vault of a branch of Roberts bank. It's a quiet area. Nothing happens here, so they won't be expecting a hit. Let's punish that complacency.
...I'm 93% sure.
The van had to leave. He'll be back soon at another location.
...unless I've missed something...
Alright, that's enough to go now if you want, but if we want more - get me access to the surveillance room so I can see what's on their network.
Man... This place... Find that gold and we can buy one of our own.
Look like the chops are ready to talk, but we can squeeze them for more cash if you just keep going.
OK people, there's the bank, I don't know what's in there but it's gonna be good...

Okay, Dallas. It's been two years since we worked together, and I need to see that you still got what it takes. We'll start with something simple, all right? An acquaintance of mine recently got robbed on a cocaine deal by some low-life mobster. I need to you to break into his night club and see if you can find the stolen cocaine and get it back. Easy, right?
I had a contact hide a cooler in the elevator for us. Drop the vials in there!
Okay, let's move it.
Keep it together! You can't fall apart now!
The thermite I gave you will let you get past the mansion walls, and inside.
First, you need to break into the depot. Try and keep it quiet. If you can't keep it quiet, make it fast.
Once you have something to break them open, get searching the crates.
There's goes the alarm. And our camera feeds with it.

Great. Now search the docks. You're looking for something that tells you which truck has the voting machines and is headed for Washington. Search containers, computers - anything. When you've figured it out, tag the right truck.
You have to keep them away from the hostage.
That's used bank notes from our 'allies' overseas.
They must think we're a bunch of chops with an offer like that. I think we should make them give us more.
Guys, you need to get those pieces to the pick-up.
They're sending in Minigun Dozers too!
The Harvest & Trustee bank just got a big gold shipment from South Africa. I think we should make it go away. I can't see they'll miss them much.
That was a superb display of stealth. You guys are made of shadows. The machines are hacked, the votes are flooding in and it is a landslide for The Elephant's man. God bless democracy!
An offer is on the table, but it's hardly even enough to bribe our dear Mayor! Press them for more, friends.
There it goes. The vault is open. It's all yours, gang.
OK, great. Now get that thing to the vault door.
OK, pull over here, and get your masks on.
Good, now get to the vault!
Keep the civs down, look out for cameras. Scout the place and find the best way to do it without raising the alarm.
...this is not my forte.
Piles of green! Thats why we're in this business, gang.
Yep, that's the inventors address. Beautiful.
It's hydrogen chloride.
There you go. The vault with Vlad's merchandise is behind a security gate.
That's... two. Two guys.
Chloride. Hydrogen chloride.
Ah,what!? Guys, you have to be careful with that stuff, I told you!
That's bag one. Keep bagging, gang.
That's it. Now wait for the pilot to signal in.
OK, this is the bank. I advise casing the place, then grab the thermal drill from the back parking lot somewhere. Hit the vault however you want. There's usually a security room so be cautious.
Ach, and they're sending in Cuff Cloakers now.
If it were me, I might hide something important in a lamp or something.
An old fashioned break in. Stay out of sight.
Nice, seems the surprise loot was cash. Bag it.
Well, logic would suggest he keeps the thing in his office, for sure.
OK, that's done. We got a pretty good payment this time but we could probably have held out longer.
You got in and out without making a sound. Good job, Dallas. I mean it.
Alright, vault is popped, but watch out for those lasers, they connect directly to the alarm
Now we wait. Remember we get a bag of cash for every painting we throw into the chopper. All we need to do is be patient and lucky.
The hostage is in danger.
Damn, that's an original Gustoff!
Now you just gotta make sure no one gets away and alerts the guards in the ICU.
Good thinking, boards will slow them down.
There's a few body bags stashed nearby.
Right, you chops. Let's get you ambling into the bank.
Best of luck, gentlemen.
Protect the hacking device!
There should be a fence nearby. Cut it open and get inside.
I think those tunnels will get you into the warehouse folks.
Don't let any civilians get near the alarms!
A jewelry store downtown has just stocked up with jewelery. That jewelery could be ours. You up for it?
...caustic soda?
Uh, I hope I got this right...
OK people, my guy says this is a good time to hit the bank. Turns out the Harvest & Trustee bank manager should have kept his mouth shut. Anything could be in here.
We are going to need ingredients, so scout the place and see what you can find.
Another guard. Stay hidden.
These fuckers chained me up! Get this shit off me!
Find the railcar with the turret. You might be able to find an access card somewhere to speed things up.
Great. Bag that body and get it out of sight before someone sees it.
Those tunnels will lead you into the warehouse.
Almost there, gang. Any second now.
Flush it down the toilet! It will mix with the rest of the kak.
Come on friends, you have the thermite. Get inside.
Uh, guys...what's that noise?
Ach, the door is locked. Buluc likes to keep his wine safe. You'll need to find the code to unlock it.
The incoming group has Minigun Dozers!
If you chops find a guitar case full of guns... just let it be, yeah?
We need caustic soda!
Great, keep 'em coming!
Three.
Alright now, I have access, hold on a sec...
Well, look... I'm going to send some guys over there to check on things.

Our client needs a blood sample from a patient being kept in the isolation ward of Mercy Hostpital. You gotta go in there, take out the surveillance, subdue the civilians and get me into the patient database so I can ID the guy. With the low security in this place, it should be a nice, clean job. I'll get you out via the roof when you're done. This job is a little shady, brokered through a third party- got some serious shadow-company military industrial vibes, but worth the risk. The payday is something we're gonna need in the future, plus a nice cash bonus.
OK, this is a fight - they will destroy the intel!
Now we need to code the tag for access. Get it to the computer!
Better find that computer, friends.
I'm going with caustic soda.
That's the tablet PC. Perfect.
We need a viral concentration of 65% or more.
Now let's rescue our friend. The cell block should be nearby.
Remember to sneak under the cameras so they won't spot you.

Dear Friends, we're going back to New York. Theres something buried in the foundation of the old Brooklyn Bank that Bain was after. Could be a way out of this current predicament we're in. While we're there, it might be a good idea to pick up some extra operating cash to keep us going. Replacing all of Bain's equipment isn't going to be cheap I can tell you, and the stuff I've got running as backup isn't going to hold up for long, yeah? At the moment, we're open targets.
Fuck! That's landmines. Keep off the grass and stay out of the camera view.
They're crazy! Shooting up the building with missiles! What the hell is this?!
There's a lot of stuff coming home. Weapons, ammo and anything that murkier elements can liberate. Check Murkywater's containers.
...caustic soda?
A contact of mine stashed a few body bags nearby just in case.
There's the drop. Snatch it and place it by the lab.
Keep cooking people. Tempo!
Ok, you made it so far and the kerels have made an offer. I think we can hold out for more.
You piece of shit San Dimas puta! Where the fuck is Miguel? I told you to get him half an hour ago!
Get into the store, watch the civilians, watch the cameras and get it done.
Keep looking for a manual or something.
Our patient should have a tattoo on his neck.
I hope you got a lot of cameras. It'll make it easier for us to find all the devices.
Ride or die - that was their motto. Well done. This intel will help us greatly. Study it closely before we hit the scientists house. Let's go get this fusion engine.
They cut the power, get it back up! Fast! The elevator won't move otherwise.
Scout the place and hit them hard. Get those jewels and keep the civs at bay. Let's get rich!
...I'm 91% sure.
Right, friends, let's keep our hostage out of trouble and safe, yeah?
That's a proper jailbreak, my friends!

That truck you assholes tagged wasn't the right one, so we can forget about intercepting those voting machines. We're going to try something else to keep the Elephant sweet. We can trigger a re-election by scrambling the server at the polling place. To avoid suspicion on our sponsor, we'll make it look like collateral damage by robbing the bank next door.
There's the main gate. Could be watched. Maybe find another way in?
If there were more crews like you I think the world would need to store its valuables elsewhere.
Alright. Scanning equipment is in position on the rooftop. Sneak in, take his mobile phone, laptop, hard drives, and tablet pc. Anything technical. Then bring it to the roof.
This seems fishy but I don't know - get the paintings on the table and keep your spider sense tingling.
The main gate is the quickest way in, but probably watched. Maybe other ways in?
C'mon, move it get into the house.
Nice job, sneaking Vlad's dwankie brother-in-law out of there. Maybe he will stay out of trouble in the future, yeah? (Heh.. not likely...)
There's another guard. Stay out of sight.
Hmm, I'm not familiar with that design. Must be very unusual. Have a look in the nearby utility rooms and see of you can find a schematic.
That's not how we do it! Never let them take you. This job is over.
Remember where that ladder is, gang. You can access the roof there.
I've arranged a false pager for a first-year resident, but first you need to get hold of a patient file.
And people are starting to talk and wonder what the hell is going on.$NL;
A door breaker! Couldn't have wished for anything better!
Your next target is the voting machines. I'll bet they're stored in sealed crates. You clowns will need to improvise to open them.
...I think so, at least.
There should be clues around to help you figure out the truck. Get Sherlocking. Look for open containers, they might indicate what the trucks are carrying.
Good, now we need at least 3 more just like this and you need to get them to the van. It's in the parking lot next to the gallery.
Blerrie, they took the hostage out from under your noses! We've messed this one up good!

Gensec have a brand new vault - the Investment Safe. Unbreakable, they say, and they're showcasing it at the arena. The door is made of their new compound - Vivinite. But everything has a soft spot. With a bit of C4 and a new circular cutter, we can steal their cash out right from beneath them.
That's the first machine hacked. Make sure you close up that crate. Don't want anyone getting suspicious.
1600 Penn, maybe we go there for our next big score.
Help the citizens of DC to vote right. We need to find the ballot machines in the harbor and intercept them before they get deployed. The machines must swing votes to me!
Look out, tear gas!
OK, that's the Petersson file. They got him isolated in the ICU and you gotta get to him. Time to play doctor, guys.
People will pay fortunes for this ancient Babylonian shit.
That terminal is showing which truck is going where. Keep checking. It might help pinpoint our truck.
Great. There it is. Disassemble it and then move the pieces out.
Vlad is grateful you are doing this job. When this shit is over, and Buluc is dead, we get back to work for real, yes?
One more, keep looking.
Use the manual to find which cable to cut, yeah?
...what's the worst that could happen, right?
I've set up the meeting location. You meet in an abandoned trainyard. Good luck.
It's caustic soda.
When you feel ready, go ahead and make your way out.
First, see if you can get inside. You might want to try a quiet approach.
Incoming! From the lumber mill! Stay on your toes!
Keep an eye out for anything you can hustle out of there. The Murkywater containers are your best bet - get them open.
Find some way past the gates without raising any suspicions.
Look at that. The kerels must think we're idiots, making an offer so low. Let's see how far they will go, yeah?
...and cross your fingers.
Reinforcements are incoming.
Ah hell. Heat is on the way. Guess the cops were watching the place.
The senator loves to collect art - outsider art in particular. Lucky for us, the Capitol Art Gallery is hosting an exhibition this week.
You'll have about seven seconds to take out the cameras before the alarm goes off.
Gang, you need to locate that turret.
OK, guys. Remember: computer, blood sample, validation and then get the hell out by the elevator. Oh, and I hope you brought something to take out the security cameras with.
You've been made! Damn, this is gonna get messy. Just keep hacking, I'll think of something.
Yeah get me out of these chains man.
Four.
...caustic soda?
Six.
Another security buffer kicked in.Need to be disconnected manually.
Remember, you're looking for the chief kerel's computer.
Grab the encrypted flash drive. It should be in a laptop somewhere.
Each vault door has a security system, and that drive will hack it open. Should be useful.
Good! Now steal one of the police cars and get out of there.

The Harvest & Trustee is a vulnerable bank so I see an opportunity for us. Case it so you can find out where. You're going to need to get into the vault using a thermal drill, get whatever's in there bagged up and moved back to the escape car. Use your judgment and don't be greedy... Good luck, folks.
The van will leave in one minute. Make sure you're in it.
Good job friends, that was some quick and easy money for us. Going to buy a lot of nice things we can use to pull off more jobs in the future, yeah?
They've blocked me. I need you to disconnect their security buffer.
Crap. That's Gensec. Get ready to deal with them.
Guys, they're trying to jam the comms. Bile is on the way but he's gotta be careful.
What the hell... you're not gonna ... other air units in the area.
That's the last one. Tip toe back to the van, and we can consider this a job well done.
OK, friends. Find Buluc's wine cellar. That's a nice, quiet way into the mansion.
Look at the that view...
Get into docks. There'll be security, so stay hidden and stay quiet.
That doesn't sound good! Be ready to fight!
We're gonna need two vials. If one of them fails the test, you gotta get more blood and start again.
That's the first one, guys. Keep working.
You need to figure out which key goes with his car. This would really be easier if we could just take any car.
You need to get inside the mansion walls. Use the thermite I have supplied you with, yeah?
Okay, take a look around and see if you can find one.
Now, the next thing is to get past the security gate so you can access the vault.
Right, now find a way into the mansion.
That's the turret recovered. The driver will be back for the ammo.
Be careful with the cooking, gentlemen.
Keep the civilians away from the alarms.
And there goes the escape driver. Keep going. I'll figure something out.
Grab the raw materials and get them in the house.
Find that tunnel, friends. They've probably got it hidden, but it shouldn't be too hard to locate.
Ninja's in socks tiptoeing on thick carpet make more noise than you. Expertly done!
All right, with that taken care of it's time to find the server room.
Damn, looks like the cops had been staking the place. Move it!
This is the gallery. You're looking for the paintings marked by a red sold sticker. We need at least four to make this work. The place is closed and locked down. Find a way in. Go.
OK, you're in position at the trainyard. Eyes open. Watch for suits. I can't see any active vehicles nearby but that doesn't mean much. Go to the train car and wait for contact.
Great! Now get them up to the station on the roof and connect them.
We're doing this nice and quiet. The computer we're looking for should be located on the second floor.
No time to waste. Get in there!
You have to destroy that evidence!

Gensec's overland armored convoys employ a lot of ex-military types, providing firepower and muscle, and they move everything from little Jimmy's favorite baseball card to the Crown Jewels. We got a line on a convoy moving into D.C. Let's see what we can get.
OK, now you can take all of Vlad's special loot, but don't make too much noise.
Get into the store, you know what to do! Let's get those jewels.
Damn thing keeps stopping. I gotta override the system. It'll be a while until it reaches you.
I'll get you out of there. Just keep the loot safe!
The surveillance operator is down. Those cameras shouldn't bother you anymore!
The machine's done. That should make The Elephant happy. Now close up the crate and keep going.
The arms deal guys... We got to get that deal exposed in the media and fast. It will create a framing effect for sure.
The evidence storage should be on the second floor, find it and use the key tag to get in.
Two.
Well done, Dallas. Head to the van and get out of there.
We don't have enough paintings yet! Can someone get me access to the computer in the surveillance room, fast? I'll get it open, don't you worry about your pretty little heads.
Watch out, friends. LMG Dozers are coming!
Pick up the phone and let me do the talking.
We have four now and four's what we need - now if you want to get more, your move.
Keep moving and don't play around. You trigger the alarm, we're screwed.
Who knows what's on that server. Blueprints, records - maybe the password for Area 51.
Two minutes until you can get the hell out of there.
Damn, this gold was likely boosted from Saddam's palace!
I'll eavesdrop, relaying...
Right, now memorize that code, chop chop.
You gotta find that safe, yeah?
Guys, I've secured a chopper to get you out. Stay put!
Now that senator Borrico has closed his little arms for gold deal, he is ripe for the taking.
Keep an eye out on the alley ways, keep those civilians down and work fast. Let's get some jewels!
Great, so much for the camera alarm.
Tear gas! Heads up!
...I think.
We're here. Get inside and get your hands on the access codes.
Real professional gentlemen! They don't even know what hit them!
Look for bookshelves, see if you can move them and find something.
Heard a story about this guy once... hid something in a light fixture, then electrocuted himself to death by not being careful when he went to get it.
They've mined the place! Watch your step!
Codes. Bring them.
Looks like they expect a fight. I know you will give em one. Find the safe and the address... get as much intel from these scumbags as you can. Let's roll.
It's a dirty job, but easy money.
And bring me back some chimichangas or something!

One of Buluc's old girlfriends "volunteered" information after we threw some cash her way, that you can find the way to open this door in a part of the house that Buluc calls the "inner sanctum". Go find the entrance to it, chop chop.
What? You want me to dress up like a cop??
Alright, they just need to call you back. Faster the better.
Kerels are trying to take back the hostage.
OK, gang. We're here.
Politics is as you know global - I need you for a global effort.
Damn, that's the alarm. Get ready for action!
Mmmhmm, fine fine.
Remember we need both the Taxman and the server, people. Scare him and make him go into the limo once we've confirmed that he has the server on him.

This is Roberts bank. It's a small DC company, almost as old as the city itself. And while I have a lot of respect for the fine institutions of this nation, I have greater respect for what they hold in their vault. My intel says this branch has the lowest hit-rate in the country. Time to change that.
OK, be careful! It will be worth sneaking all the way through, boys. No alarms and this framing will be perfect!
That dinges is not going to crack without causing a racket.
Yeah yeah, just put on your mask now.
What about taking the manager's fingerprints off something with a piece of tape, so we can bypass the scanner quietly?
That door is too tough for the drill. But I'm sure the armory will have something that can take it out.
That's what we are after. Get it to the van.
GPS is online. Providing you tagged the right truck, this is great work. Time to go.
C'mon friends, the manual should show what wires you need to cut.
We have to hurry! The cop's radio is buzzing like crazy. They're already on their way!
OK, no time to lose, get all that intel.
Here we are, get in there and get me required amount. We go in quiet and go out with a boom!
Great, that one's hacked. Get that crate closed, then find another.
Outstanding work. Tonight, you clowns made yourself a friend in high places. You'll never pay another parking ticket in this town.
Yeah.. I ... I don't know .. It could have been a big gun.
Kerels are sending in Medic Dozers with this round.
Look around. There should be clues that will point you to the right truck. Perhaps matching their color to the containers.
This is Roberts Bank. How may I help you today?
Alright, bring it to the van, it's right across the street.
That should get the process going.
Next step is to code the tag. Get it to the computer!
Open sesame, friends!
Yes, Duke lent me a book. But exactly why are these things so important, aside from their considerable monetary value?
First, you gotta break into the warehouse. It'd be great if you can keep the noise down.
Look inside the containers. Find what cargo they're carrying. Maybe that could help you figure out which is the right truck.
Now cut him loose.
Damn! Someone saw the body! Take him out before he calls it in!
There have to be clues around the wharf that'll help you figure out which truck is carrying the machines to Washington. Keep your eyes peeled.
Soda. Caustic soda.
You're going to need to get into the vault using a thermal drill, get whatever's in there bagged up and moved back to the escape car. Use your judgment and don't be greedy... Good luck, folks.
Keep your eyes on the hostage!

Things got messy, but you got through in the end. The hacks worked. It looks like the good lady Mayor's people was behind this. The press are already sharpening the knives for Schwartz. Needless to say, The Elephant is ecstatic. You have served your city well tonight, my friends.
OK, the cameras are installed in the paintings. We're ready. The senator's men are jumpy but ready to deal with us. So let's deal. Money for art.
Excellent. We're almost done. Bear with me.
...IF my calculations are correct.
Use the camera to see when they turn on, and then turn them off again.
Head over to the phone, the phone's ringing. Make the contact there.
Don't worry, I'll lead the way.
Maybe you tell me what is going on with Bain and what you have planned next?$NL;
Knock knock! Now find the prisoner!
The PC is showing where the trucks are headed. Keep an eye out for those bound for Washington.
Shit guys! They got an aircraft launching rockets!
Nice. Now start her up.
Somebody, grab the phone and let me handle it.
Nailed it. Keep going guys.
That computer is showing which truck is going where. Could be valuable to know that.
They can keep wondering all they want. Payday business is no one else's.$NL;
OK, gallery's just ahead. Watch out for motion detectors, cameras and guards. Get in there and bring me four of the paintings marked with a red sold sticker. Time is ticking guys.
Awesome. Now just sit tight for 30 floors...
That's one of the voting machines. Great job! Alright, when the coast is clear, get the hack started.
Intel guys, intel! Get it!
Gentlemen - today we vote. They say: one man, one vote. I say: four men and lots of votes. I need you to rig the voting machines in my district.
Check the schematic and find the right wires!
You need to get in there, get our man out, and destroy whatever incriminating evidence the kerels are keeping on him. Got it?
Gage sorted a dumpster to stash a bit of loot in. His people will collect it in the morning.
Those shipping crates are sealed tighter than a gnat's asshole. You need to find something to break them open.
Maybe the contents of those shipping containers can help you figure out which is our truck.
I like the sweet sound of that! Now, leave it be for a few seconds and we should be in the clear.
This place is running low on supplies. If you wanna go for more ingredients, signal the chopper with a flare. This pilot's on the clock, so make it worth while. Or you can bounce. Your call.
Alright, one more minute til the time lock opens the vault.
One.
OK, we can leave now, but try and take it all if you can.
It's open! Bag the gold!
Uh, Barney's not available right now. Can I take a message?
You can access the hidden cameras in the paintings with the laptop on the roof.
The bluechip hired henchmen are here.
That certainly looks like one of the voting machines. When you're ready to kill democracy, start the hack. Make sure no-one sees you.
The van had to leave. He'll be back, keep your eyes out for the new location.
Here we go. We should be through in a couple of minutes.
Check the camera and see what's in the vault.
Found a schematic yet?
We're not going in by the main entrance. You see that fence? That's our way in.
Time for the main act, getting our friend out. Look for the cell block, it should be nearby.
Watch out, guys! The cops are surrounding you!
It's open! Let's see what we got!
Use his computer again, be careful, they only go down for a small amount of time.
Search well and eyes peeled for guards.
Okay friends, time to crack this nut. Find a way in.

I've traced the truck to a warehouse out by Goose Island. It's a distribution depot, contracted to ship the voting machines to their final destination. With a little technical wizardry, we're going to make those machines a bit more sympathetic to The Elephant's mayoral candidate - that slimy ballbag McKendrick. Get in there, get them hacked, get out - simple. Once again, The Elephant is extending his stealth bonus if you can keep it quiet.
Gold bullion. Probably taken from the enemies of freedom.
The armory, friends. Try following the smell of gun oil?
Get ready friends, we're almost at the target site.
That's how much we need. You guys can stay and get more if you feel like you are on a roll!
Two more, keep on searching.
The Elephant gave us the locations of the biker gang hunting for the scientist's little device. I think they're close to finding him - we need their intel so we can get to him first.
That should be all the clues. You should be able to figure out how to open it up now.
Gage has arranged for one of the dumpsters to be used to stash some loot.
Alright, that'll keep Gage sweet. You guys can cash this out now, or stay for more.

The Elephant's PR will claim he came to power through depth, leadership and integrity, but that's bullshit. That oily bastard's going to cheat his way to the Senate, and this is where you come in. There are trucks at Pier 39. One of them has voting machines. Find the truck and attach a GPS-tracker to it. We'll deal with it down the line. Naturally, The Elephant wants this done with as little chance of bad press coming back to him as possible. So he's ear-marked some of his considerable campaign funds for a special black-ops bonus. You guys do this quietly, and the good politician will see you well rewarded.
Use the kitchen blender to make an evidence cocktail.
You've got to find a way past the gates.
They've seen you! The trucks are moving out. Alright, we need a Plan B. Lemme think.
Bliksem! Don't disturb those lasers! Can't find anything in the blueprints about them. Probably added later. That kind of system can usually be disabled via the roof.
See if you can find the evidence. It should be here somewhere!
Ready for the shot? OK listen: you are looking for the paintings marked with red stickers. They've got unusually tight security here. A lot of cameras, even a security room, so do your homework.
Yeah, tell him his ass is on the line if he isn't available for the regular time-lock check in.
There's an offer on the table. Not enough in Locke's humble opinion. Let's hold out for more, yeah?
You're not supposed to get captured, you chops! We gotta give this one up.
You got one of the keycards, now find the other one.
Did you press the right floor? Press the right floor!
For a murdering low-life cartel gangster, this guy knows his wine. Shame you don't have time to take some back.
Vlad, we don't have time for this.
Pull over here. There's the warehouse up ahead. Let's do this.
Looks like the key tag needs a higher level coding for the armory. You'll have to recode it.
Looks like LMG Dozers are part of the assault this time.
That was an excellent piece of whisper-work. They didn't know you were there. Now let's see where that truck leads us.
I'm gonna need the car key here, guys.
They're going for the hostage. Stop them!
That's the depot where the machines are kept. Move out, you clowns.
You should be searching, not dawdling.
Roberts Bank. Everything's under control. How can I help you?
Bah, that offer is for chops. We can make them do better fo' sho'. Stay frosty, friends.
We've learned that most of the time, you can find Buluc in his office brooding over something, so it's a good place to look for him. Find it, yeah?
Oh, dear. You're not going to break that open without making a lotta noise.
Just your friendly neighborhood kek, yeah?
Blerrie, They're sending in Cuff Cloakers along with this group.
Mr. Sturr, I presume? You got the data?
I'm putting you through to our CEO. Please hold.
The voting will begin tomorrow. We need to act now to make a difference. New voting machines have arrived in the harbor.
Now find some way to destroy it!
We need to get him out of that prisoner outfit. Find him a spare police uniform!
What... hey! Did Vlad send you to get me out?
Their doors open with coded key tags. See if you can find a blank one that we can code.
Use your key to get into the evidence storage. It should be on the second floor.
No drill will break that door. But the armory might have something that can take care of it.
Medic Dozers coming as well. Bunch of kakspul!
Good job, everyone. That chop gave us an OK bundle of money to take home, but next time maybe we'll do better.

I'm sure you guys have tangled with Gensec before. They're the East Coast's premier provider of security solutions, if you believe their brochure. But, PR aside, these guys are serious. Today, we hit them.
Yeah, they're ready for us judging by the number of lookouts... Looks like they have cameras too. Make sure you get close before you hit 'em.
OK guys, search the place. They have a safe somewhere, it's probably in there.
Check the safe - find it. Fast!
Everyone, you know how it's done. My guy dropped the thermal drill in the parking lot, so grab that before you make your move inside. Some surveillance would be smart.
Now it's just a matter of time.
Dammit. Now we go the painful way.

We got a bank here. Not a big branch but I've learned the vault is temporarily holding stacks of cash in transit. Foreign exchange notes. Anyway, you know how to do it - your way. Sneak in silent, or unleash hell. Either way, I got a little idea for how to lift the money out of there. You'll see what I mean. I think you'll like it.

Alright. You're in. Now hunt around. There's gotta be a clue about which truck is carrying the voting machines to Washington. Search containers, check computers - anything you can to figure out the right truck.
OK, now look around. We need to tag the truck headed for Washington. Look around for clues. Containers, terminals, any records. Find the right one, and tag it.
Tracker placed. Signal coming through. Now haul ass, and let's hope we're chasing Elephant's machines.
Getting a nice clear signal. Time to leave, guys. I hope you tagged the right truck.
Crap! You were seen, and the convoy is rolling out. We need another way to find our truck.
The trucks are on the move. Someone saw you! OK, time for another plan.
Those containers have cargo. That might help you eliminate the wrong trucks.
One of these trucks is the one we want. When you've finished searching for clues, get the tag on the truck you think is our target. You get one chance, so make sure you're certain.
Pier 39. Find the truck that has the voting machines. It will be bound for Washington. Figure out which one it is, slap on the tracker and get the hell out. Keep it quiet.

Great work! The hacked machines have made it look like the Mayor's people were behind this. Even if an enquiry exonerates her, the papers are hurling so many buckets of shit at the Mayor that she's finished. And The Elephant? Well, his man is picking out new furniture for City Hall. Great work, gang!
That'll keep nosy bastards from spying on our business. Good.
What a flat! These arms deals sure are a nice addition to his senator pay.
Theres a jewelry store downtown, fairly simple target. But be ready for the heat if the alarm goes off.
The new jewelry store down town is loaded with jewels. Those could be ours. You want to pay them a visit?
Great, we need at least 3 more, get it to the van. It's in the parking lot next to the gallery.
You need to take the marked paintings to the senator's apartment. They'll have cameras installed in them. Eyes on the inside will make your job easier, trust me.
OK people, get the phone. Let's get this trade out of the way.
OK, now let's just hope they call you fast.
OK folks, everyone into the train.
OK now remember, one bag of cash for every painting.
OK! We're gold. I think I got everything we need. You should be able to access his desktop computer now.
It's located in his office.
There's just a little problem... I don't actually know where the vault is, physically.
If you want to go for more, use his desktop PC, it should open the vault up for you.
We have to shut them off.
Drugs planted, senator framed. Bad guys 1, Politicians 0. Well done, very smooth operation in there. The Elephant will love this outcome.
That's the depot. You know what you need to do, but keep it quiet. If the alarm goes, I'll have to pull you out.
A nice stash of used dinars. Good find.
I hope they weren't giving this marching powder to our boys.
This coke won't be funding any more terrorism. Just good old American crime.
Columbian. Bolivian. Mexican. Wherever it's from, it's ours now.
Rifles, pistols and bullets. This will make Gage happy.
The vault needs two cards, entered almost simultaneously. You can bet there's something particularly tasty in there.
Those Murkywater containers are brought direct from the world's hotspots. Crack them open. They'll be your best bet for loot.
The driver's gonna bail! Make sure you're with him.
A good start.
That's the armor of Oda Nabunaga. Bag the pieces. If that's genuine...
I can't believe we scored Oda's armor. Outstanding work!
That was text-book whisper mode, guys. Great work.
Okay, keep an eye on what's happening. We want to actually see the server.
He put something inside his shirt.
WHAT! Guys get your heads down.

The Taxman thought he was clever making a deal with a big corporation, but the information leaked, and now bigger sharks want in - all in. We have a complete, run-down building to ourselves, overlooking the deal. We've got a set-up installed. Alex will help with the crane. Scare the Taxman into his limo, shake him up, and he'll be sure to give us the server and the codes. When it's about $25,000,000, anything goes.
You killed one of them? Damn, I can't say the prick didn't deserve it, but Wick wanted the pleasure himself.
You got nine cameras to take care of.
Great, now down the ramp and get outside.
Whoa. Close one guys. How you feeling?
Seven.
Ok, that takes care of the cameras.
There goes the alarm. Guess we gotta do this the hard way.
Hello, B-uhm... nurse Bain speaking. What do you need?
Really? Ok, we'll be here.
They sounded convinced. We're in the clear for now.
Guys, you got guards coming. Take them out before they find anything.
There's a repair man coming to check the cameras.
You gotta find the patient file, guys.
Whoa, that didn't take long!
OK, gotta find a way to make sure none of the hostages does anything stupid. Set up the fake sentry guns.
Don't forget- stay in character.
Door to the ICU is open, get in there and find that patient.
If that's the wrong room, we'll have to cut the other doors with a saw. We gotta get that blood sample...
Still not enough, you need to take another sample.
Maybe... two minutes. IF I don't get interrupted.
Come on guys, express elevator... going up as soon as you push the button.
That's strange... merc units are pulling out.

Pack your bags, gang. This one is south of the Mason-Dixie. We're going after Mitchell and Wilson - couple of counterfeiters down in Pensacola. Running a printing operation out of his basement. It's a discreet operation, and this guy's work is solid, so he's making serious bank. Let's grab a piece!
Here they come guys. Choppers and SWAT vans all over the place around you. Stay on your toes!
SWATs incoming from the lumber mill. Keep them away!
They are coming in from the lumber mill, watch out!
They are coming from the railway bridge! Watch out!
SWATs are incoming from the forest next to the road, be careful!
Remember to be careful! We can not use the wrong ingredient. You need to be careful!
The process is done! Bag it up, and let's do another round.
Get the bags to the van to secure them. Don't let the cops run away with your hard earned meth!
Good thinking! Use those boards to barricade more windows.
There are only a few ingredients left. You want more, just use a flare to signal the helicopter. He's got what you need for cooking more. Or you can bug out now. Up to you.
OK, now wait for the pilot.
Great. Let's cook a little more product. Just don't set anything on fire.
We can't use the lab anymore, it's gone

This is a simple job, but that doesn't mean it will be easy. We're going to head out to the forest. You remember the place. We did some work for Hector out there. Anyway, I scoped the place out and it is still intact. So, we're headed there to cook up as much meth as we can. You can stay as long as you want. If you run out of supplies, I'll get more flown in. Should be easy money.
You guys remember that sketchy old house out in the forest? Where Hector's guys were cooking up meth? Well, we're headed back there.
This is the place. It's hardly changed.
They turned the power off! The lights are down.
They cut the power to the house! Lights are down.
Cops killed the lights - get it back on.
Get into the house.
Good,OK, the reaction seems fine, keep going.
OK, OK good.
Alright on this webpage. What did you just add? Alright. OK, OK.
OK, let's try that.
OK, solid.
Legit... I'm sure. Cooking fine.
Shit, you got crawlers outside. Watch those windows!
Alright, let's see...
Hold on...
So, next step iiis...
Now we need...
Alright, next ingredient...
Uh, if I read this correctly... uh...
Muriatic acid.
Acid. Muriatic acid.
Oh I'm going with muriatic acid.
We'll go with muriatic acid.
We'll go with caustic soda.
Oh I'm going with caustic soda.
Hydrogen chloride.
...hydrogen chloride?
I'm going with hydrogen chloride.
We'll go with hydrogen chloride.
You got some of that somewhere?
That should get things cooking.
Add some.
Pour it in.
Hold up!
Wait!
Hold it! You didn't put it in yet, right?
Yeah it's acid, muriatic acid.
It should be caustic soda!
That should'a been caustic soda!
By method of elimination it has to be caustic soda.
I messed up. It should'a been hydrogen chloride.
By method of elimination it has to be hydrogen chloride.
...for sure. Or, most likely.
...that's my best guess.
...it has to be.
...this website better be accurate.
...yeah... yeah.
...and kiss your lucky charms.
...I'm 86% sure.
...I'm 84% sure.
...I'm 68% sure.
...I'm 57% sure.

Guys, we need to talk about what happened up in Alaska, but I've got another job first, while you're still out west. So, the son of an old friend of mine in L.A., member of the Cabot crime family needs help hitting a jewelry store for a haul of diamonds. I owe him big from years ago, when his dad got me out of a jam, so I promised him a little extra muscle as payback. These guys are pro's, real characters. They even use code names! You guys up for it?
Keep moving and get inside.This might be a game to you, but there are guards all around.
Hurry! Answer his pager before they raise the alarm. Try and improvise or something.
Okay, good. Now, bag that body and get it out of sight before someone comes looking.
How about that dumpster?
That dumpster should do the trick.
Okay, good. Now, keep going.
Eh, screw it. It doesn't look like you'll be able to pass him undetected. Take him out.
Remember to hide that body.
I got your back this time, but in the future you'll have to pay for these kinds of "special" favors. My contacts are good people and they expect good money in return.
Behind those crates should do. Now, get the other guy. Remember to grab another body bag.
We're lucky that Control-Guy is stupid as hell, but he's getting suspicious. Next time he'll most likely sound the alarm.
Throw him down there where no one should find him.
Easy now, Speedy Gonzales. Hang back and let him pass first.
All right, this is the place. Remember, we're here for the access codes.
Use the ECM Jammer to disable the camera, that way you can lockpick the door undetected.
Damn it, Dallas! I told you to use the ECM Jammer. Destroying it will draw unnecessary attention.
Now get back inside and look for the computer.
Sneak by it and look for the security room. If we do that, we can disable all cameras at once.
Answer the pager and we should be fine. The cameras won't present any more trouble.
Bring the flash drive with you and get out of there.
I stashed some more body bags if you need some. Always plan ahead, Dallas. Always plan ahead.

All right, Dallas. It's time to use those access codes we stole last night. Find a way inside the building - access the Police database and delete all the intel they have on Crime.Net. This won't be a walk in the park, so show me you still got what it takes.
Damn! Alright, I'm sending the drill.
We can hack open a train vault if you plug that hard-drive into its security panel.
I'm reconnected. Thanks.
Alright, I'm back in.
The blueprint you found was for a new Type of Turret. It looks like the government is transporting it soon. If we act fast, we can catch them off guard and steal it without anyone noticing.
An access card. Great! That will help you get silent access to a railcar.
We can sell those shells, if you can carry them out. But focus on the turret.
Gently does it. Very gently.
OK, we're into the railcar. Use the camera to see what's inside.
One high-tech, high-value piece of military badass right there.

That blueprint you found was for a new type of infantry turret - codenamed RC1. Real next-gen shit. Digging a little deeper, I got word of a specially chartered train, headed in to the Pentagon. I've hacked the rail network, and they think they've stopped due to a glitch in the switches. Three railcars. One has the hardware. The other two have its ammo. It all sells, but your priority is the turret. They won't be expecting you.
You need to get close and locate the right railcar. Once you've ID'd it, look around - you might be able to find an access card for the railcars.

You got... Is old family thing. Don't you mind... just get it out of there!
